page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY:Looe is known to be a very ancient port and was probably a trading port by the name of Shute at the time of the birth of Christ.The name Looe translated into Gallic means Pool and could refer to the confluence of the East & West Looe rivers above the town forming a pool.The ancient derelict chapel of Lammana can be found together with one wall of the Monk's house in the fields at Hannafore.The 14th Century bridge spanning the river was unusual in that it had a Chapel in the middle.It was demolished in the 19th Century when the present bridge was built.Looe is said to have supplied more ships and men per population than any other town on the south coast against the Armada.
